Ip3VfViYPPc_AZFZq5DU7w.text: I'll start with the positives because i don't want to come across as (too much of) a curmudgeonly git.It's a good use of space compared to the quasi derelict hovel it used to be, and to be fair they've done a good job with decor and atmosphere - it's quite cosy and "hip" feeling, as you'd expect from a coffee shop on the corner of hipster-ville. It's also a nice touch that they have a small wet bar serving a few decent spirits; their cakes looked ok. Oh...and it was heated; and it was very cold outside.Now the negatives - maybe i just have a wildly different notion of what coffee should taste like, but being italian, having lived in paris for a long while and having worked as a barista throughout my youth in many of London's popular caffès i feel i know my way around an espresso machine; but in my opinion their coffee was not good. There are almost no words to describe how stomach-churningly disgusting the espresso i had there the other day, was. I once had some friends play a practical joke on me by adding a dollop of ketchup to an espresso i ordered, while my head was turned, which i then proceeded to drink...this one tasted worse. It was as if somebody had emptied half a salt shaker in there. This is normally an indication of someone having burned the beans/coffee from packing it too tight or updosed/under-extracted. Either way a barista should have played the trial & error game in his own time to get the extraction right. Adding insult to injury is the fact that a single espresso costs £2.10!!! almost twice as much as many other small, independent places (that do a far superior coffee). What is it with hipsters that makes them think it's a good idea to rip everybody off for a simple product offering? Im sure this will provoke much bemoaning about how their latte/flat whie/capuccino are wonderful, but the espresso is the building block of any caf no matter how much cream and chocolate powder you use to mask the salty horror.Not wanting to condemn somewhere just on a one-off (every one has a bad day), i tried it again the following day, but the experience was the same.

akNwDRQgbOrhWmgHvSewIQ.text: Mega good coffee In the hustle and bustle of old street. This unique little building offers a panoramic view if perhaps the ugliest roundabout in England. But don't let that put you off. Great coffee is hard to find and the food is pretty sweet too.

nMkaLIGeXJoBwro5QzZYqw.text: One of the best coffee gems that has sprung up in the growth of the Tech City has been the increasing importance of coffee shops.  And, while there are the typical staples of EAT, Benugo (who have recently picked up their coffee efforts) and POD - the Shoreditch Grind is a great find.The coffee is strong and handled with care - especially when Cass is behind the espresso machine.  Let her make your coffee - whether it is a flat white, a decaf latte or whatever.  She - and the other barristas - make hellaciously good coffee.  And enjoy the pastries and other niceties that have - including 28 Proof!

56fr3_yKsM3WNjVwcxRG_A.text: I am so happy this place opened, because it is literally in my living room and a better alternative than starbucks (I lived in San Francisco for too long I guess). The place is cool looking inside and out and the coffee and snacks are great and it has some good looking baristas!

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom

tXgmYEeXauHq1GDfhY5CfA.text: Always busy here. I can understand why people love to come here. They serve really really nice coffee. It is very worth to come over. They located just exit8 of Old street station.

DSCfxEeCUUh4o5jyJuNNJw.text: Lovely shop, great coffee, ace atmosphere, but rubbish service. Shoreditch Grind is the perfect little coffee shop in Shoreditch. It's hipster-y, but not in an obnoxious way. Music is played loud, but not too loud, it's all wood and spray painted logos inside. People with asymetrical haircuts mingle with tech dudes in regulation light-blue-shirt-and-khaki-chinos. People fiddle with their iPad or tap away (on a novel I presume) on their stickered laptop. The coffe tastes really good - a little small, but that's because I'm used to chain coffe place giganto cups. The cake and pastery selection is also very impressive. Thing is though - the staff were pretty crap. One guy was behind the counter and didn't serve. The main barista took ages to acknowledge my presence and was really, very quiet and a little miserable, and the one manning the machine I heard say 'arrgh my brain!' (or something like that) after a few too many orders at once. At least in corperate-coffeville the staff are well trained and helpful. Sort out the staff, and five stars will be yours.

LHxbhjTH1UCnTfwG3T2ANQ.text: Great place for an awesome latte! Stopped in here for lunch and had the avocado salmon toast as well as the croissant, both of which was excellent. Very low key with some outdoor seating, and not too crowded on a Saturday afternoon. Service was a little slow, but the staff were very friendly and welcoming!

vDotb9AFs_jo2NdbvMmoDw.text: Located right at Exit 8 of Old Street station - this is my new neighborhood locale. I feel hip just walking inside. Only good things to say. The service is quick and friendly, the coffee is delicious & the sandwiches are available hot or cold - and yummy both ways. With the warmest summer we've seen in London in a few years, you can also enjoy the outdoor seating and a cold beer.

g9RMsIz3HllWgpSng3MQZQ.text: No problem at all with service and good coffee (ok not a Starbucks pint, but good) and muffin. Nice vibe and good for people watching. If there's a grumble it's the uncomfortable stools, but maybe I just need a skinny arse to go with my skinny latte

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom

el8MWNOuluRK9lrzc9p2OQ.text: Great coffee, hipster ambiance, and nice view of Old Street. Free wifi makes it a great place to study and hang out.

fCN9hH0nFJsnTewuVMNQ5g.text: Nice coffee shop, very casual, but kind of loud.  Yummy sandwiches and other treats.  Friendly staff, friendly customers.  I'd give this a 5... but seating can be tough to get.  Nice outside seating when the weather permits.  A must visit if you are near Old Street and need some coffee.

TOPsLpHI5rRfLN8Qw_YDpw.text: The coffee is delicious.  The food is pretty good too.  The service...is hit or miss.  Also...I'm all for quality coffee and having to wait for it...but this place borders on ridiculous.  That doesn't stop me from going there regularly though :)

qavTUe6aIx-_f7MiNUS6bg.text: Shoreditch Grind looks great and is well located.I was disappointed by the coffee. It's average for an independent coffee bar: better than the chains, but nothing like as good as at Monmouth, anywhere on Leather Lane, or de Santis, for example.The service is far too slow: when there are 4 people working behind the counter in the middle of the morning and there is no queue of people waiting to order, a five minute wait for a simple Americano is not good. I'd rather go somewhere where the staff are recruited on basis of their customer service skills and not the contents of their wardrobe.A perfect example of style over substance.

TXdYmvHXxSrKIYDoah12Aw.text: the coffee tastes good but it always takes to long to get, which then leaves you with a warm/cold coffee that you drink in seconds.. I think I must of waited 8 - 10 mins today for a coffee when it was pretty quiet.. I could just see all the shots lined up ready getting cold. Don't think I've ever walked out and not finished the flat white or large cappuccino at work, and I'm only a couple minutes walk up the road.good taste, great people but slow service..

MJebT6DlLIjzhUzhib-vbg.text: For about the fifth time I was served after someone who ordered after I did, and the place was empty. These guys have a problem with expediting their drinks and the too-cool-for-shoreditch attitude makes me feel as though I'm not worth their attention. Good coffee, but lots of competition. Bye guys.

w0sH9OQE4243ltsGf2ql9Q.text: The marscapone rocket salami panini is absolutely fab.  I might order a second....

MbUl6ek-37YpISqEMR_HOw.text: Great coffee, but the service, though friendly, was very slow and the price was very high £2.95 for a latte?? Really??

0PA-YxIwkK5D8vNmDgWBvg.text: was really unimpressed by shoreditch grind. there were at least 3 people behind the counter and between walking in and having my drink brought over, there was a good 10 minute gap.when i got my drink, it was average. lukewarm (if i'd have left it more than 5 minutes it would've been cold), not a very generous size or particularly well made (i had a hot chocolate and it tasted like it had been made using instant stuff you get at the supermarket). also, served in a little glass which i guess was meant to be quirky, but i personally like my hot drinks in mugs. genuinely would rather go to a chain coffee shop than return here (which is useful, as there's a starbucks just around the corner).

ff3SP_LmUu5-uc8qThk5Ww.text: Really busy, likely because of the great location and great space. As a result it was a bit slow, they didn't do filtered coffee, and the flat white was okay but didn't make an impression. Good for a meeting spot or to people watch. Ok for coffee.

VblTk1BpANtNkIyzqnqyCg.text: My favorite coffee shop in London. Delicious cappuccinos and iced coffees with a great view of Old Street corner for fun people watching. What more could you ask for?

cf4t641kGP6LU_kaKvq-SQ.text: Can't beat the location on Silicone roundabout, great to kill some time if you arrive at Old Street a bit early. Coffee's great and the staff are lovely. I'd got for the Latte personally, it was great!

MG3oe_UpsithsdVBPHztKw.text: In the Old Street roundabout you will find Shoreditch Grind, a small coffee shop with a lot of originality. The coffee is good, while the limited selection of baked goods is very reasonable too.

8LOrsS3uF7yoA5jH61XfRg.text: I still have a soft spot for ya, SG, but the lack of customer toilets is a super bummer.  (Am I right, ladies?!)  ***Toilets have been added, as per a note from the owner, and that is joyous news, indeed!Today, I had the most delectable slice of pear/lavender cake for 1.50 to go with my flat white.  It was SO incredibly moist and struck a nice balance between pear slices and lavender essence.  My friend's four-year-old liked it so much he helped himself to seconds and thirds!  (Note: to preserve your cake sit far from the prying hands of small children.)

ys_z-p2qLePYEHA2rDpflQ.text: Cool cafe. Docking points because I stepped over to get a bit of work done, and the wifi was not working, so it was a trip in vain. Hate when that happens.

e4rCICIa9-ieURISDuM3GA.text: The coffee here was excellent, but the place can get quite crowded. They only have the seating area indoors downstairs, which is mostly a few shared tables and then bar seating along the windows. I was able to get a seat at a table, but it definitely can get noisy and busy. During the warmer months they have a lot of shared tables outside, which is fantastic, although it is located at a busy intersection.

HSWrBC_B_s8T9gBsPUC_jw.text: My quest for a cup of coffee in London has now taken me to the trendy east side. I lack the slender sleek body of a Shoreditch hippy, I lack the skinny jeans / trousers that the kids rock here, I lack the hipster fixed gear bike that people ride around here (I look like I've got a Ferrari parked next to a whole bunch of Volkswagen busses) and I certainly lack the appreciation for Shoreditch Grind as many people have here. Maybe it's just my taste in coffee, but I've now come twice to the Grind, and I have to agree with Larissa. There's something lacking in their coffee. I've been to Taylor Street Baristas, and Speakeasy, Monmouth and Workshop, and while this is decent coffee in London, it's a bit like old world vs new world wines. The coffee here has a very delicate flavour to it, but it certainly lacks punch. It's very drinkable, but definitely lacks a unique flavour. It's akin to drinking a starbucks latte in a pretentious looking shop. The decor is cool, and rocking, but not the coffee. Anyone got suggestions for decent coffee in the area? #Notcomingback

piAo4WpDFQf-1U0EidcJXg.text: I was in the area and desperately needed a coffee, so I was headed into Starbucks when I peaked around the corner and saw this cute little gem. I jumped at the opportunity to get my caffeine fix at any place other than Starbucks, so I headed in.Nice music in the background, delicious looking pastries, and prices better than the big brother around the corner. I went simple and ordered a small latte. The lady at the counter wasn't the nicest, but I ordered and sat down. They brought my latte to me with some pretty art on top, and I sat there reading while I sipped this delicious treat. Nice espresso, good temperature, no complaints at all.They have splenda! My sugar of choice isn't in many places in London so that was a plus. They have chilled, flavored water for self serve which was great, plus free wi-fi.A win for me!

KLWXcHORZEsg0-i0u7jeGg.text: Best espresso Martinis ever!! But be careful one too many will have you flying!!! Also love the decor and the pastries they have in the morning so delicious.

i0ZBiyL9cn6Q2jDTPS91PA.text: Great location. (The almost) 180 degrees of windows in the front give great access to the mass amount of people walking past thanks to the busy Old Street roundabout right in front. The staff are nice and even suggested I do a take-out tea vs. stay in since it's bigger but the same price.I usually sit at the counter facing the windows for optimal people watching and reflection (double meaning) staring out into the busy world of London. But, insider tip, the stools can sometimes seems super low, but the post under the seat are really just big screws, so just turn that baby around a few times and the seat moves up or down depending on what you want.Great music that made me wish my iphone was working here in the UK so I could shazam the sh out of the tunes they were playing, and a beautiful leaf in my cappuccino. Yep, this place is tops.

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. yum

FdUtQdgxVc0LBYkT6mP4Kw.text: Good coffee, nice staff and cool outdoor seating area.Jenny and I stopped here on the way home tonight. Handy spot to lock up the bikes outside. Given it was 27c we opted for iced coffees which were delivered to the table outside in twee jars with a straw. The coffee was good, nice people in the seating area, would definitely go there again.

0ySs9DbpuEgW3ohUIJ-KXw.text: Shoreditch Grind is a cool and beautiful creature. It popped up on the dismal and utterly depressing Old Street roundabout while I was away and is like a beacon of light in the area. Sorry, dodgy kebab shops, Linzi has no love for you. It's not me, it's you, you're a 3am mistake that I would never make. I love the wraparound windows and the cinema style signage (displaying 'coffee makes you last longer' cheeky messaging). Inside it's very Shoreditch hip with matching cute baristas. The non-tattooed need not apply.It reminds me of JJ Bean in Vancouver, I'll never truly feel I'm cool enough to be in there. But what I am cool enough to be is gainfully employed and can afford your expensive coffee and gorgeous looking almond croissants. I'll see you in the morning, SG. Make mine a double.

Nvd-0KYYwbAbBvrREXUACQ.text: Shoreditch Grind is a cute cafe/bar conveniently located just outside the Old Street tube.  They serve coffee and drinks.  It's a fun spot but space is limited.

qI5av6fW4E0ZKT35PLz57A.text: I was forced to go into this place with a couple of Australian friends who wanted to get coffees, but I warned them not to eat anything.  The Shoreditch Grind has a food hygiene rating of 1 out of 5 -  "Major Improvement Necessary".  Absolutely gross.

QDKsyPDP5w7vk00SnLbdFg.text: Seriously good coffee. Quite possibly the best Americano in central-east London. Also fabulous service.And it's right outside of Old Street station. It is, however, bloody fecking loud in there all the time. As in, you go outside and the windiest roundabout in Britain is quieter. No, really. They play loud music and it's circular and they have all hard walls and hard floor and... well it's not a good place for a meeting.Even though everyone wants to meet there.Must be the coffee.

ldW6fqfl-6yQlrvhmqGKzw.text: I do find hipsters boring, but I'll deal for a sexy flat white! Thanku grind, I love yr coffee, yr toilet, yr vibe and the toxic pollution from the roundabout! I wanna make u my local.

MiX82G7tDrO3RT1mf0fr2Q.text: I dropped in to Shoreditch Grind this morning as I was working in the area and had been wanting to try the place out. If I could give the place three-and-a-half stars I would, but as I can't, I'm erring on the side of caution.The interiors and external façade are possibly the best thing about the coffee shop for me. The faux cinema-style signage out front is eye-catching, with the (presumably ever-changing) sub-text below the café's name urging you to "Flick Your Coffee Bean". I'm all for caffeinated innuendo, but this seems a little forced; perhaps a good analogy for the rest of the operation?The problem for me is twofold. The coffee itself is actually rather average when compared to places like Prufrock or Caravan nearby, with predominantly disinterested or too-cool-for-school baristas (some of whom I've seen elsewhere, such as Lantana) serving up lukewarm 6oz cups of mild disappointment.Additionally, whilst the place is cool to look at outside and in, with only a bar around the edge and a single communal table it doesn't really lend itself to being a sit-down-relax-and-exchange-conversation/ideas type of place. Which is what a coffee shop is all about after the quality of the coffee, right?Don't get me wrong, this coffee served from their La Marzocco still beats the hell out of a roasted-to-oblivion EAT or Pret job, but the location and staffing just meant for me that a takeaway seemed the best option. When your immediate opinion of a place is that you want to get out of it soon after arriving, the omens are not the best.I'm still not convinced, but at the same time it's really worth a poke. To be fair also, the prices are pretty damn solid and cheaper than the chains. I sure don't mind the Shoreditch Grind - I just couldn't ever see myself loving it.

iOT-9mxOE69CeW2AnZiNzA.text: Not often in life do you meet genuinely bad people, but the management and owner of this establishment were the most unpleasant characters I've had the misfortune of working for. Don't be fooled by the flat-pack bohemian faux-hipster decor, this place truly represents what Shoreditch has become about - money, money, money.

BIXV3hQ_vjPd0QLfNw0RXA.text: I have come to accept that every single coffee place makes drinks differently, despite having the exact same names for things. So I asked the cute kiwi at the counter what her macchiato was all about. The barista says "expresso" when describing the elements of the drink.My expectations plummet. But she didn't make it. And it wasn't bad at all. Not amazing mind you but better than most. Small space but I like the way they've sorted out seating and the food displays. Makes me want to buy everything on that damn counter. There's seating all around the edge and a communal style table a little off center of the room. But doesn't make me want to stay and study or catch up with a friend. Definitely coming back here if in the area and in need of some good quality caffeine.

r1h9A5j3W2Rze7lD7OV-Ew.text: Great coffee but unfortunately too noisy for serious meetings as the music is super loud. Otherwise good.

7TgrzZX12CVvZcN08Rw2nQ.text: This place is very new. Excellent coffee, can't speak for the food, but the baked goods look tempting.Excellent space and huge, hubble-lens-clean windows make for a nice space to spend a bit of time in the morning, catching whatever early morning sunlight London has to offer.I'll definitely be back, and wont be surprised if I end up revising this to a five star review (but that'll take time - consistency is the whole game in coffee in my book)

6y_a0ykEd6x2lB-mwcee-Q.text: After reading and hearing so much about Shoreditch Grind, I came twice with high expectations. Probably a mistake...The atmosphere IS really cool and hip. I love the design of the interior, so I was pretty excited as I approached the barista.The two or three staff who served us gave us snooty attitudes, making us feel like we were completely uncool or just not good enough for their place. (OMG, it's not even an independent shop!!)  So, though we wanted to have a treat, the way they were glaring at us while we were trying to decide made us so uncomfortable we didn't order anything to eat. Husband just ordered a flat white and I ordered a mocha because I wanted chocolate.When our coffees came, we tried each other's drinks and both thought that, on the whole, the drinks were too milky. Of course, I'm one who likes her coffees with a big kick, so maybe I'm just not a big fan of the beans they're using. My second time (flat white) ended with the same conclusion, though, so, hey, it's just not for me.HOWEVER, their cocktails do sound very interesting... I'll be back to try those, but I'm not sure if I'll be back too soon for the coffee.

BZGVr11Xb6WUvM-G124AIg.text: It's a bit of a hipster magnet, but you won't get any looks for not having a handlebar mustache and claiming a window stool for the better part of a morning.The coffees, while not Fernandez & Wells epic, are damn good. The latte is rich and smooth, and requires just a hint of the demerara sugar sitting in an open cup nearby.The desserts seem to change daily, and while a tad pricey (near £3) I had more than one I'd easily have again, especially the pecan cheesecake.There's one big catch though if you're coming here to work; while the window seats appear to be endowed with plugs aplenty, they're not actually on. So quash any hopes of an extended freelance work day.

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Large latte

4-7qcI-N3Dvh4DtkB1mtRA.text: Only been here once so far, but I'll definitely be back.  Despite a substantial flow of people at  this convenient location at 9am on a Thursday, we got our flat whites quickly (+1 star), they were very good (+1 star), the croissants were excellent (+1 star) and served by friendly staff (+1 star), and to cap it off, there was space to quickly down coffee and pastry at a picnic table in the sunshine (for the final star).  Another great coffee shop in East London - if I wind up living nearby, this could be my local.Oh, and I saw Buffalo Trace (although no High West) whiskey behind the counter, so it might be worth an evening trip as well.

wYIpdbEtaMSdzfduneLGGw.text: Consistently great coffee put the 'Grind' chain in my top 5 coffee spots in London.I typically get takeaway from all their branches including this one, but actually really like this branch for cocktails in the evening. They have a seating area outside that is nice in the Summer and their coffee based cocktails are lovely.Notable mention for the cold brew (Nitro) as well which they serve on tap. Best I have had.

S2XbxOs479c79XcJRROA4g.text: The big brother of Grinds. Situated at the roundabout. Very cool advertising at the front. Like an old cinema style and they have bespoke messaging. Brought the work guys from nearby Hoxton. Most of them new how good it was but the rookies soon found out. Great coffee and treats. One of my favourites in the city. One of the many stand outs in Shoreditch.

7Mxr00hqNRPfqKlmUZDwIQ.text: great location for a quick hipster coffee fix. this place is pretty empty on sundays with a few peeps on their computers typing up words.a big cup of ice latte with soy milk adds up to £3.50, kind of running on a steep end, but nevertheless the latte was good. they also have a membership card, 10 drinks = 1 free drink

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. soy ice latte, yum!
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. green tea with green leafy goods

YWqq7ZPJcvuPcHgrwSbQrQ.text: This was actually the first of the Grinds that I visited and while I now prefer the Soho branch this coffee house is still really good.   The coffee itself is great, the snacks and treats are lovely and in the evening they do a really nice job of turning it into a low-lit cocktail bar atmosphere. The espresso martinis are not to be messed with but are very delicious.

BXhfs2nByDaXzCZjo9LMZQ.text: I have had mixed reviews with shoreditch grind, ranging from excellent to them forgetting my order and then delivering the wrong coffee. There is also fierce competition in old street and my top two coffee shops are down the road, so I might be more biased towards them. Like all coffee shops, it largely depends on who your barista is. The beans are great, the overall decor of the place is great and the coffee when delivered correctly is great. I'd agree with a lot of the other comments around there being a slightly judgy/pretentious feel to the shop, which is absent in soho grind. I still like the place and will always be back.

4Ybdtql3MkrL1c8Zf25PZA.text: Great Espresso. Edgy Music. Lots of hipsters. Loyalty card FTW.

inRML21o3VlJB9JUmWQ0_g.text: You don't realise how bad other coffee chains are until you have coffee at a place like this. Along with Ozone, this has to be one of the best coffee shops in the area. It's small, and doesn't have much seating room, but the skinny flat white I had was nothing short of divine. Oh and a slice of their red velvet cake was heavenly as well.

lhw-oyV7xNR9yeBDKeTYwg.text: I love every single one of the 'Grinds' around London. They have found the winning formula for great coffee and a great shop to match. They seem to be popping up all over the place recently - which makes me very happy - but haven't lost their stand out, great quality of food and drink while doing so.   Shoreditch is a great place for people watching, with indoor and outdoor seating right by the Brick Lane station exit, you can wile away a good few hours here.

EBpT85A-NCIZoIv7qep-iQ.text: Good coffee, good brownies, good sandwiches!The girl behind the counter even got me a fresh sandwich when I ordered one, instead of giving me one of the ones sitting out.That was extra nice.

vkc3NeDustvMZ-s2iXQY_Q.text: A solid addition to the east London coffee scene with it's bolshy Antipodean staff and home roast Americano. What use to be a tacky mobile phone shop is now a super sleek espresso bar, light and airy with a fabulous view of Silicon Roundabout. The coffee is five stars, dark, rich, bursting with coffee goodness and for £1.70 a cup it's great value for money. The venue with free wifi and loads of bench seating is also fabulous. They need a "push" sign on their front door, it was like The Crystal Maze trying to get in this place. A glass box of coffee goodness that is impenetrable! They take card and have a selection of yummy looking food. I'm looking forward to coming back and having some lunch there. They are doing everything right and I'm super excited about the day I can sample their roast as a filter. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom

lPmW5G8A-pNw2S005_4QgA.text: Not bad. I hade Machiato and Brochette with tomato and basel. The brochttee was good but I had better.  They didnt have much of baked treats to choose from when i was there. However, it has a good ambience, great music and coffee so it would be good place to meet with friends.

MWgESdJ9PcQivz0fj-s6eA.text: PROS: Great coffee, great people watching, tasty cake & pastries, and a nice staff that doesn't bother you if you're hanging out for a few hours working or chatting. The outdoor seating is fun, too!CONS: The internet didn't seem to work, and neither did the power plugs below the window. The stools are SUPER uncomfortable after a while, so it's not meant for a long work session anyway.

6ovWMBcliNm5cYeerWRsmQ.text: Keep it up, friends! I had a very tasty latte. I'll be interested in seeing how they do, since it is a great location and a local coffee place was much needed in the area where Starbucks is the only option. They have a variety of good looking paninis, some baked goods, and straight forward coffee drinks of the espresso sort. I forgot to look and see if they did filter as well. It is a cool-looking minimalist space, and as I said before, clutch location. They have some stool bar seats that look out into Old Street circle to sit at, but they aren't terribly comfortable. This is NOT a coffee shop to linger at all afternoon or study... More of a quick sit in or take away only kind of spot.All at pretty affordable prices. A small latte was £2.I'll be back to try you again soon! They also appear to have wifi.

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Latte!

JLOo_EU5vObVQg7aYqufEA.text: I do love the Shoreditch Grind. It's big retro cinema sign and it's dark wooden decor, exposed bricks, spiral staircase inside and neon lights, very vintage feel. It's becoming my local spot with my boyfriend before he sends me home. It is a shame it is so small so like many Yelpers have said, it's not a place you can sit for long and wind down as you're more likely to find yourself a window seat on a high stool than a table seat. But saying that one of the best things about it is that it is also open late, till 1am on the weekends.But the place holds a good vibe, probably because they sell coffee cocktails but I am also impressed they serve their own branded coffee and there's a deli bar where cakes, sandwiches and hot soups are available. Sadly I've only tried their hot chocolate and latte but they were good. Both personalised for me with a nice  fancy latte art. In fact that barista was so impressed with what he had achieved he came back to take a photo of his art which was funny. My hot chocolate was so indulgent, it was thick, rich and smooth. The nice foam on top created a layer of bliss as it lighten it up a bit. Not only did it taste good but it looked amazing, cute even.My latte met everything I needed from a good latte. It came in the perfect temperature, a good layer of foam and a nice richness coming through the creamy steamed milk. In the summer I can see myself sitting on the outside beaches watching life go by  the old street roundabout. It is memorising and somewhat a nice distraction from city life. The place itself could do with more comfortable seating, maybe fit a few retro sofas in. The place has so much life and so much potential but it's a shame there's not enough space for people to add to it. Still I love the place. Just people would just go away and let me have a seat :p.

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. My teddy bear latte art hot chocolate
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Flat White

4SWTMvjiP8ogueln4esNtQ.text: Good solid neighborhood coffee spot! Eggs on toast is a tasty light breakfast. Had a cold brew and it was solid. Pastel de nata Portuguese tarts. Yum! Would go again!

uASNoibFCa1XrTHylwmBAw.text: I have a LOVE/hate relationship with this place.Firstly, I love it... I'd argue that they do the best flat whites in London. They are spot on 99% of the time. Their other coffees are great, and the food is genuinely brilliant most of the time. Of course the unique building and great location add to the lovin'.But, I also hate it (a teeny, tiny, small, fraction of a bit); it can get very busy at peak times. Like, "wow, I'll go next to [insert corporate 'coffee' chain] instead" busy. Also, the staff seem to have their on and off days. Most of the time they are very pleasant but other times they seem either like they're on the come-down from hell and give you 'the death stare'.In fact, ignore me - it's brilliant - try it!

kDsqpiEjxqH_QMQJEUlCsg.text: One Sunday while I was in the area picking up some coffee for home, I decided to stop in here for even MORE coffee (with the prodding of a fellow Yelper...). I gave them my standard cappuccino test. The coffee here is good, better than many places in London. The Canadian barista was wondering where we were from, and he was surprised to hear that I was from a place even further north than he was.While the coffee was good, I'm not sure I'd come back. Unfortunately there's a much better coffee place quite close by with amazing coffee. Given that it's hard to find good coffee in London, I imagine if it was just in a different location, I'd probably be more willing to come back.

715AbRnxHxAMTw_FCuWAHw.text: During my visit in London, my friend suggested I visit the Silicon Roundabout seeing as I went to university near California's Silicon Valley. I was wandering around until I stumbled upon Shoreditch Grind and remembered it was on a list of top coffee shops to try; so I decided to pop in.I ordered a Mocha and eggs with avocado on sourdough toast. The man who took my order seemed indifferent, so I can't comment on friendly service. There seems to be 4-5 people behind the bar, but 2 pulling shots of espresso.While I was waiting for my order to arrive, a few thing stuck out to me:- Non-working Wi-Fi.- Complaints about the outlets not working, however, I cannot attest to this as I didn't need to charge anything.- Uncomfortable seats along the windows.- Indifferent customer service.I would understand popping in here for a cup of coffee before heading off to work; however, the experience here is nothing spectacular, so it's not somewhere I would go out of my way for.If you are a coffee enthusiast, stop by and try their shots, but otherwise, I'd move along.

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Scrambled eggs w/avocado on toast + Mocha

SW1B8fqjsLso72ibSovQtg.text: Excellent pastries and cereal bowl options with a range of coffee, tea and smoothies.

PTrinGGh7UWMVhluLRiH_g.text: You know, I don't think I've ever had a bad experience here - and it's definitely somewhere I've been regularly coming for a number of years! Ok so mainly I get takeaway as I'm usually on the go, but the times when I'm in here for meets, to work or people watch have always been quality. Considering it's like a little hut (think ex-cinema) it does the job and must be like a goldmine with all the people who pop here once hopping off the train. A great little place, love it! ps - get cake, it's always good.

Y6vlUOb6ANKZOOqHGzATDA.text: The cocktail here was delicious and the atmosphere of the shop was great. It was a fun place to hang out with friends after walking around the brick lane market. I had the Maiden London which I thought was a bit pricey but it was still good.

K-tPg3m3qLiwlVxsGis6_Q.text: Velvet cake rocks. So does the aperol spritz. And the coffee.  And the pictures on the way to the bathroom. With a terrace and a cozy room it's the perfect spot to do the Sunday afternoon transition from coffee to cocktail.

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. The velvet

rMivyECMNZ4rCjOJd75hVw.text: This place definitely is deserving of 5 stars, great atmosphere and customer service and excellent lattes! I had the 'Golden Road' latte which was made with soy milk and turmeric. It was so creamy and delicious I ordered one more to go! This place is definitely a must if you're in the area.

lb68x8mjZo3iGNylsz37Qg.text: An Americano for under £2? Let's get down, let's get down. It's a bit of a scene, and on an extremely busy roundabout/tube station (Old Street), but don't let that stop you from poking your head in. The median age of constituents seems to be about 25...and the acoustics make it seem like there are 100 people in there instead of 25, but none the less...this is Shoreditch and you likely need some caffeine, so get you some.I had planned on maybe staying for a bit but it was just a bit too chaotic, and not many seats (perhaps they have seating upstairs? I am not sure...I didn't venture up the staircase), had we been rocking some more temperate weather, their outside seating is nothing to shake your head at. It's incredible, despite the busy environs...it's an oasis. However, it's officially December so I wasn't expecting patio weather. If you're looking for a bit quieter spot to perch, check out Pitfield a few blocks away. Got my Americano to take away, all staff was nice enough (not overly nice mind you, would you be if you had to take orders over all that noise!?), the music selection solid and the vibe one of happily caffeinated hipsters in the prime of their lives. Also, they serve drinks at night I hear. Will certainly be back for that. I'll make it part of my rotation. Good, strong coffee and a pretty kick ass marquee.

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Flat white
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Latte
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom

HX6dG4DKOefOj7cUOCAtQA.text: I really like Shoreditch Grind, so much so it's pretty much where I always go for coffee in the area. I like that there is a buzz, the music is louder than your typical coffee shop and the whole place just has a nice energy. Great for people watching if you sit along the window too. I've always been pleased with the coffee here, having tried a few single origins that they serve as standard in black coffee (which is great). This week I tried the food and was perfectly satisfied by my smashed avocado and poached eggs on toast. If the weather was different i would feel like I was back in Australia. Must come for some espresso martinis one night

HTOzS1ubyUxQ-fBjAdeEEQ.text: Avocado toast was great- but the Americano and iced lattes we ordered were poorly prepared and the acai bowl was very bad

aAaM8xjRGw78RiWBNhOipQ.text: Great location, lovely place, great coffee. What else? I love this grind. I went there out of curiosity as I used to walk down the place very often but never stopped by. And the least I can say is...  I did well finally stopping by, especially on a (very rare) lovely sunny day in London. Perfect spot for a casual meeting.My friend had some tea, I had my classic Iced Coffee of "hot" days. She liked her tea, nothing special. I did really love my coffee. Not the best I had in London for sure, but it was very good and refreshing. We sat at the back terrace, a truly amazing spot for this location. A lovely time, for a very decent price. I was honestly "expecting" it to be more expensive given the location, so the bill was a bit of a surprise. A pleasant one, indeed.If you enjoy the hecticness of Old Street and hang out around Shoreditch, give this grind a try. Good coffee, lovely baristas and waitresses. Actually, very lovely waitresses. I most definitely will go there again for a coffee break in the area!

bouTISu41xpmKNupCWqgXQ.text: Coolest place to go for coffee near old street station. Bonus points for turning into a bar in the evenings. They also have some pretty good pizza.

AD3HUxWTEp4xUDx62JSeBA.text: I suppose it depends on what you choose your coffee shop on, but the Shoreditch Grind is not a place to relax at all. I enter, go to the bar and I couldn't hear the barista over the music at all. I sat down on one of the most uncomfortable stools ever, a poorly made screw contraption that was small, wobbly and hard edged. The music then got even louder, with everyone screaming to talk to each other, I gave up on my newspaper.. And wrote this review.Tldr: Too loud, get coffee to go, or come with mates you don't really like talking too, and bring a cushion.

lNKfDVRZ2sqLErU1_mpCLw.text: The coffee world is a small one. You could almost describe it as somewhat incestuous. If you speak to somebody in coffee chances are they'll know somebody you know. It's also often known, unfortunately, for being wanky (for want of a better word). The thing is, more often than not, it really isn't. You can chat to the barista behind the machine and ask questions about your coffee and they'd be more than happy to chat away. Then you get those places where you walk in and the weight of the judgement hits you before you've even reached the counter to order. One such place attuned to the latter is most definitely Shoreditch Grind. On a brief stopover in London my other half and I wanted to scope out some good coffee spots. The Grinds always come recommended so we figured we would stop in Shoreditch Grind and check it out. Biggest mistake of my entire trip to Europe (and that includes a night I mixed vodka and red wine on an empty stomach whilst on a train...). I ordered 2 double espressos but I also really felt like a milky coffee. Being lactose intolerant I opted for a soy latte but, before ordering, I asked one barista - let's call him curls - if their soy separated in the coffee. Curls said "sometimes but not really, we use bonsoy so it's good milk". Winner! Milky coffee on the way - soy latte, no foam. Well, coffee arrives. Two single shot espressos and a separated soy latte with a good inch of foam on top. We drank the espressos rather than letting them know they weren't what we had ordered. I then gave the latte a good stir and let it settle twice to see if it would be okay. No such luck, it was pretty dead so I took it over and asked if they could make it again, this time with no foam (like I had initially asked for) but maybe if they used only one shot it would be less likely to curdle; I won't go into why but it's an acid to milk thing, science and that. So as I head over to my seat the rambunctious barista with the "I haven't had a shower in 5 days" grease and bad tattoos, we'll call him Portly, starts shouting loudly for all to hear "WHO ORDERED A SOY LATTE?! WELL IT'S ALWAYS GOING TO SPLIT. WHAT, SHE WANTS ONE SHOT? WELL FINE. I'LL GIVE IT TO HER IN SEPARATE GLASSES AND SHE CAN MIX IT HERSELF HARHARHAR" Genuinely? I thought he was kidding. It was probably what he thought was an in joke to those in coffee regarding the recent Melbourne cafe that successfully broke the Internet by serving up a "deconstructed coffee". How wrong I was. Out comes a deconstructed coffee for me to make myself. Behind the bar Portly is still laughing at his hilarious stunt. Naturally, I walk up to the counter and request a refund. Curls let's me politely know my coffee is on the way as Portly looks up and realises, sheepishly, that I wasn't sitting outside like he had originally thought but in fact had heard everything he said. As I said I didn't appreciate the way they had spoken about me and my coffee order, I was told I had "misheard". He then tried to make out like he had being doing me a favour by allowing me to make the drink myself, pretending like I couldn't possibly have heard him laughing about how hilarious it would be to "just make her do it herself". No, no, it was just a "misunderstanding" to which I promptly replied "it wasn't a misunderstanding at all, I heard what you said and it was you thinking you're funny and just being a rude d*ck". Okay, calling him names wasn't my finest moment but it was true... I then waited at the till for my refund as loud Mr Portly had gone sheepishly quiet but still shout-whispered "kill me now" repetitively. Thanks Shoreditch Grind for keeping up the "all baristas are pretentious wankers" image alive and kicking. I'll just head over to Ozone coffee instead. (For those in the area, you make a swift body swerve around the Grind to the opposite side of the roundabout and its down an alley, only about 3 minutes away.)

h9Y0QHG2b9xNLZbKnwljuw.text: Shoreditch Grind is one of my top 3 coffees in London.  Top 5?  Solidly top 5.  So, it's pretty hard to miss if you surface above ground around Old Street; I think it's really strikingly beautiful, actually, with "Shoreditch Grind" splashed across a marquee and the surrounding brick painting black.Inside - as several Yelpers have pointed out - acoustics make it seem like A REALLY FRANTIC SPEEDDATING EVENT.  Except all those speed daters are on Macs, powering up their Tweetdecks.  Not hating, just saying that today I popped in mid-morning (a weekday) and it felt like it was a social media manager networking event (I'm pretty sure it wasn't).  Anywho: quite a few spaces to work downstairs (communal tables, window-bar), bathrooms upstairs with two weird bar seats (prime...erm...bathroom proximity I guess?), but I've never stayed around to work at Shoreditch Grind because it's kinda frenetic.  In a generally good way.  I think the staff are always super friendly and try really hard to remember my name (today - "what's your name again?  Ah, Alice!" - totally great try).  And just generally: 2.70 for a larger-sized totally delicious flat white.  And lime and orange water in jugs by the side.  And mega-carby-delicious sandwiches.  (Other things look nice, too - holla, portuguese custard tarts! - but I can't vouch for them from experience)Yelp note: they have a loyalty / membership card system in place.  1 point per coffee; free coffee when you get to 10 (if I remember details correctly).

BS4nrW8LnW0HIAZSYlisfg.text: I adore this place for all of its cocktail magic. Also great for meeting up with friends for a catch up and/or desserts anytime of day.

Sk02BiaooxrycZUKYfmg2Q.text: Friendly, funny staff, loads of different people, good atmosphere, nice coffee. Had an iced mocha to suit the strangely warm weather. It was deliciousss

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Iced mocha in the warm weatherr

-2myYbhETX9tYiVbA78vTg.text: Great coffee and breakfast :) If is not to cold you can stay out side and appreciate life. CHEERS

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Espresso martini
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom

VIdEhKfZOFwbY_waAcL87Q.text: None of the other reviews mention the booze.Shoreditch Grind is a coffee shop that lets you enliven your experience with spirits. I didn't try the coffee, but I did try the espresso martini, and it was delightful. I don't normally go in for sweet cocktails but this was a nice caffeine-laden pre-dinner drink on a warm afternoon.There is plentiful outdoor space to enjoy your beverage, and interesting graffiti in the restroom if you need entertainment in the loo.

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Restroom graffiti.
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Espresso martini.
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom

N27FPc_GFDkvcQJf9OBd2g.text: I've been riding past the Shoreditch Grind for months - it's on my way home from the city and it has always caught my attention. I finally popped in yesterday to grab a coffee and it had me wondering why it had taken me so long to make a visit. I had originally ordered a flat white, but then changed my mind at the last second and ordered the Hot Flat White Russian. (It's pretty common knowledge amongst my friends that I have a loving relationship with spiked coffees - there's always a bottle of Bailey's in my cupboards.) I'm so glad I switched for the boozed filled version of the flat white. It was DELISH. It was just what I needed on a Thursday late afternoon/early evening after a long day at work. Haven't had a regular cup of joe here so I can't really comment on that, but based on their espresso based cocktails, I'm gonna say they're pretty fab. Can't wait to get back there!

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Yum. It may look like another coffee with pretty foam art to you,  but in fact it's a Hot Flat White Russian.  Delish.

YlfVj7YgLesHeXIc4SKleA.text: Only been for drinks, but this coffeehouse/bar hybrid has strong drinks in a trendy atmosphere.  When crowded and rainy, finding a seat is nearly impossible and it's not exactly a comfortable place to stand about.  Last time they didn't have either of the 2 drinks I first ordered, and considering the limited scope of the drink menu this was surprising, but what I eventually got was good.  Would surely go again.

gSpvVeXksFay-31Ski7GhA.text: I had a week long stay in London and stayed in the Shoreditch neighborhood. Needless to say, I ate here three times for breakfast. I had a cappuccino each time and it was very good. Full of flavor.I had the Full English breakfast twice with scrambled eggs. Everything was delicious. Also had the breakfast burrito, and that was great as well.Fun atmosphere and great service!Five stars!

kzY0_1Ri48zvJMiNyHlp_Q.text: Horrifically rude and racist service. There were very few customers in the shop, but myself and another Indian customer were completely ignored. Servers were more interested in chatting with each other than taking our orders. Took 15 minutes to get a coffee, because my first order was ignored, and another 15 minutes to get the bill. Very disappointing. I've never experienced such racism in my time in London before, and I will never visit another Grind outlet again.

CwQ1vX1u588RMRQEEwqHMg.text: What a wonderful place on the Old Street round a bout. We got brunch there on a weekday morning and I enjoyed my whole experience. A small place to be sure, but we were seated right away despite the busyness. I got an ice coffee and it was SO GOOD. The first actually good iced coffee I've had since moving to London. So for me, that's worth five stars in itself. The waiter was super kind which was nice. The breakfast food was exactly on point, though my poached eggs may have been a bit over done. Definitely a hipster atmosphere, which is to be expected for the location. Shoreditch Grind is a must go to experience in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom

D1BbC_jmHaAGP1h79k9pqg.text: Loved this place right down the street! From their cocktail sign to their punny saying on the front of their shop, this place is super cute and trendy. They don't have a large variety of menu items, but my friend and I loved our food. I even got a mocha latte since they didn't have vanilla (what???) and it was actually really good. The place was pretty packed but we found a nice place to sit outside on their patio. Everything was trendy and fun. It was a great brunch and I'd definitely go back again whether it's for a meal or a night out!

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Ham and cheese croissant and avocado toast!
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Mocha latte.
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. They turn into a pub at night!

UigIWcG2RbENAbGNVpSlyA.text: Love this place. Been before but was disappointed. New ownership? New staff! Fabulous!

55F8CD0on7Ps8rxIydtLzg.text: A great coffee shop in a central Shoreditch location. Hipster/trendy style interiors, friendly stuff working and nice brunch dishes. What else to ask for on a weekend morning?

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom

F0sQvjnBfz8FmtUL9AVAWA.text: For coffee and lunch and drinks. Great local vibe for people watching and impeccable beans. Highly reccomend

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Tomato and caprese
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. The front of the store

ejY75lXh4ES0TvwZyctDQg.text: This place was pretty close to my hotel, stopped in for a pastry and drink before exploring the city, really enjoyed the overall vibe, the service was good and my pastry was super fresh.

TmMJzCgud1kieZeBKzwwQg.text: I live nearby and would walk by every day thinking, what is this grungy, hipster place, without giving it further thought. As I started to get more into the Grind chain of cafes, I gave this place a try and have been coming back consistently ever since. I like it and it's funky.The only real downside is that it's kind of small and the music is loud on the weekends.Coffee is good. Not out of this world, but they make a good soy latte. Pastries and cakes are yummy and their menu is really good. The green smoothie is really tasty and the cacao pieces are yum!I tried the granola smoothie bowl. I thought it would be like an Acai bowl, which it kinda is, but it's not as good or naturally sweet. It's filling though and a good portion. Always see people ordering eggs, or avocado toast on weekends, which I've never tried here.Definitely worth a visit and it's great for people watching!

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Coconut orange muffin
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Soy latte, green smoothie and a coconut orange muffin
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Soy latte

uIFsRd7RwBhqDa4jLC8T5Q.text: Pretty good coffee and pastries. For an american, a coffee shop that becomes a bar at night is still a new concept. I have been there for both sides of the transformation. Their cocktails are more on the simplistic side but they serve the classics and serve them well. It gets pretty loud and crowded, but it stays open late (well not late for an American). *If you go for a coffee around 4 -5 p.m. on a weekend they pretty much consistently ask me if I want alcohol in my coffee :)***

6Ly8RWUEcLl_MMVZB8fuZA.text: Being from Los Angeles, I love me the coffee scene in any way, shape, or form. Is place is in one of the busiest hubs in e city, located right across the underground rail station on Old St, so it's always busy. And loud. It's worth it for all the people watching you get to do and soak up the ambiance of the city, though.The coffee here is freaking amazing. They have all the different offerings a good coffeeshop should have, including Nitro Cold Brew. They're roasting it up right, too, because that ever-sought-out robust coffee flavor is present in all of their drinks.The food is great, as well. It's a modest menu, but hearty and fairly healthy. Their sourdough toast with butter and jam is on the harder side, but still good. And their hot porridge with coconut milk, summer berries, and chia seeds is just what the doctor ordered for a complete healthy breakfast to go with your morning java. They also serve salads, eggs, focaccia, salmon, and plenty of other healthy breakfast items, including cold-pressed juices until 3PM on the weekdays and 5PM on Saturdays, and until closing time on Sundays. If that sounds too healthy for you, they serve your quintessential cafe pastries here, as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Golden Latte- Golden Grind Tumeric with Bonsoy Milk
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Hot Flat White Russian
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Espresso Cocktails?! Heaven

gQw85dLuT1vwyli9q2G5kA.text: I usually only come for the red velvet hot chocolate. It's the best hot chocolate in town. The food is also very yummy, as well as their juices but defiantly the hot chocolate is the winne

oT_Fc76DqNWbTHyE27gVEA.text: Directly outside of the Old Street tube stop is a wonderful bastion of Shoreditch cool in the form of Shoreditch Grind.  The space is a semi-circular bank of windows that looks out into the Old Street roudabout and bathes the space in light.  There is often mid- to late-90's hip hop blasting in the place, so if you are looking for a quiet, cozy café - this is not the place for you.   They also have pastries and make some tartine-like breakfast plates.I have been here a few times and all the drinks were fantastic.   I have had iced coffees as well as espresso.  The iced coffee is served in a rocks glass that you would find at a bar.  I like that touch.  We also got matcha teas, cappucinos as well as veggie juices.  They never failed to make a very good drink.

67V655vocTcGtxbTXwE7gw.text: Great coffee and extremely interesting rotunda building. Hands down one of the best coffees I've found in the area. I love the red light sleazy, up late, lighting and vibe. Downsides: it's noisy and hard to find places to sit sometimes. Also had a couple of cakes here and now tend to avoid them, which is a shame really.Upsides: they do delish coffee cocktails, great service and reasonably priced. You gain hipster points...

lWeAkq7ZhNya_YAqfOQ0Gw.text: Shoreditch Grind is right off of the tube, so many points just for convenience sake. Things we tried between 2 people:- hot porridge (oatmeal) with coconut and fresh berries: warm, yummy, creamy, comforting, fur filling. Happiness in a bowl. -smashed avocado+smoked salmon on toast: pretty solid. Loved the chili slicers. Tasted even better with a crack or black pepper + squeeze of lemon. - banana bread with creme fraiche: liked that the bread was overly sweet. Warm and toasty, topped with honey and creme. -fresh pressed red juice: consisted of apples + beetroot + blackberry + banana: really fresh, but a tad sweet for my liking. My friend also really enjoyed their coffee. We were so stuffed from our quick stop here. A great alternative if you want a delicious breakfast on the go. Would like to come back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Red juice- 4.75/ coconut porridge- 4.50/ smashed avocado toast 5.50 w/smoked salmon 2.50/ banana bread 5.00
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom. Menu as of 4.21.16

SeylcyEUkGT7ObIcJD-Q2w.text: Very cool place. I had some time to kill before getting on a shuttle to Stansted, so at 7am, my friend and I desperately needed a cup of coffee to get us through the coming hours of Ryanair agony. I had their latte, no complaints. I shared the blueberry muffin, which pleasantly surprised me. Instead of just dried blueberries, it had a gooey center. Clearly fresh baked (and yummy). The baristas were sweet, and it seemed like lot of people popped in before work to grab a cup to go. The ambiance is trendy, and I'd recommend stopping in!

PIrl_dkAV1_kFta1064Vrw.text: I loved this place.  Excellent coffee and the food was beyond yummy.  I can't say I enjoyed British cuisine during my 1.5 week stay so finding this place was a godsend! Definitely give it a try.

QXxlrRM914NaILsQsL6vEQ.text: Went to the Grind for the first time and the food and hot drinks were great! I had smashed avocado on toast with a poached egg and a hot chocolate; both delicious! The portion sizes are a tad on the small side for what you're paying but it is a nice environment and good food! The music can be a little loud and it is quite busy but it's definitely got that city brunch feel!

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom

0GMGGv1t17xF_OWKVPjZkA.text: Trendy, trendy! This is the place to go if you want to mingle with whoever is mingling here. I didn't like it though as it was cramped, noisy and expensive! However the service was brisk and the coffee was incredible...

photos.caption: Photo of Shoreditch Grind - London, United Kingdom

rFTQjU2KxhlhTB2IFbjnPQ.text: We went here twice during our time in London. You can't go wrong with the mocha, the macchiato, the green smoothie, the salmon, one pan eggs, and the avocado toast.

SbV3VJomx87Q5eJy7SHXLw.text: The coffee is so good I have taken to walking the three miles to work just so I have an excuse to go past it!  Definitely the best coffee in London right now.  It might take a little longer than you are used to but only because they are taking such care to perfect your coffee.  When I get over my fear of hipsters I fully intend on spending a relaxed couple of hours there one Sunday :-)

P1mZb4ZSKanirS7VOm2Ueg.text: Perched at the crossroads like a dust-covered drifter with an illy cup is his hand is the best coffee in Old Street. Five star brew at the roundabout? Yep. I admit that I'm shootin' from the hip on this one, and am likely to put someone's eye out, but they are simply the finest grind in this area. The drinks and food, albeit limited, are great- definitely try the raspberry muffins.There is also plenty of table and bar seating and friendly chatter. With a relaxed atmosphere, good music, and free wifi, it's easy to forget what's just outside the panoramic windows. They're my local caffeine connection of choice, so I'm biased, but The Grind is one of the rare jewels in the roundabout crown and definitely worth a go. Cheers guys.

qthTEwuKhkSopH32a0J_6Q.text: Cute store kitted out in typical Shoreditch fashion next to Old Street roundabout. A welcome addition to the Shoreditch scene  probably not the best on offer in the area (there is some serious competition) but competently done. Service was smooth and friendly. Grinding up a mix of hipsters and suits that suggests they will be here to stay .

p7Fj7iIAsekGVIyexyE7RA.text: Good beans, clean spot, decent food options, and gotta love supporting a local coffee shop! My small Americano was nice and a typical indie price of £1.80. And a massive bonus and good to know for hungover mornings is they have coconut water!!!

sHdmCp1d6N-Vk499SWgBfg.text: Only OK. Quality of the coffee is relatively high but served with an unfortunate level of pretension. Internet so slow that it is almost unusable. Food pretty good.

R1iCnR9NEJGsCffqJG-FoA.text: looked for hours for this place its actually not in shoreditch which says it all really
